body_html:
@davidmascharka I believe you may be hitting bug #9917 in torch.bernoulli(p.expand()). The workaround we're using in Pyro is to call .contiguous() on the argument to torch.bernoulli():

torch.bernoulli(p.expand(shape))               # broken in 0.4.1
torch.bernoulli(p.expand(shape).contiguous())  # workaround
body:
@davidmascharka I believe you may be hitting bug #9917 in `torch.bernoulli(p.expand())`. The [workaround](https://github.com/uber/pyro/pull/1294/files#diff-120fbe36e4b03a2335f19d622512e077R51) we're using in Pyro is to call `.contiguous()` on the argument to `torch.bernoulli()`:
```py
torch.bernoulli(p.expand(shape))               # broken in 0.4.1
torch.bernoulli(p.expand(shape).contiguous())  # workaround
```
